casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Appellee, v. PEERLESS WEIGHING & VENDING MACHINE CORPORATION and Consolidated Automatic Merchandising Corporation, Appellants. No. 433. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. June 10, 1938. Smyth & Tuttle, of New York City, for appellants. Lamar Hardy, U. S. Atty., of New York City.

Before MANTON, L. PI AND, and SWAN, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The order will be modified as to the Peerless Weighing & Vending Machine Corporation by computing the interest at six per cent after March 27, 1935. The appeal of the Consolidated Automatic Merchandise Corporation will he dismissed.
